20110112010127.000|20110112010130.000|TR0| He was off.  That's the best way I can 
20110112010130.000|20110112010132.000|TR0|put it.  He was definitely off.  He -- it 
20110112010132.000|20110112010134.000|TR0|was obvious that he lacked the sane 
20110112010134.000|20110112010136.000|TR0|ability (ph) to connect socially that 
20110112010136.000|20110112010138.000|TR0|other people have.  He would grin a lot

20110112010200.000|20110112010202.000|TR0|include the Doors and Jimi Hendrix and an 
20110112010202.000|20110112010205.000|TR0|anarchist punk bank called Anti-Flag.
20110112010205.000|20110112010207.000|TR0|

20110112010209.000|20110112010211.000|TR0|favorite books was "Mein Kampf".  It's 
20110112010211.000|20110112010213.000|TR0|hard to draw any conclusions about 
20110112010213.000|20110112010215.000|TR0|Loughner's politics from his reading or 
20110112010215.000|20110112010218.000|TR0|his music choices.  What's clear is that 
20110112010218.000|20110112010220.000|TR0|Loughner is a troubled young man whose 
20110112010220.000|20110112010222.000|TR0|behavior became increasingly erratic in 
20110112010222.000|20110112010224.000|TR0|recent months.       SPITZER:  Here are

20110112010259.000|20110112010301.000|TR0|to buy the Glock that killed and injured

20110112010308.000|20110112010310.000|TR0|the first time about what he knows of 
20110112010310.000|20110112010312.000|TR0|Jared Loughner.  Kent Slinker taught 
20110112010312.000|20110112010314.000|TR0|Loughner at Pima Community College last

20110112010330.000|20110112010332.000|TR0|
20110112010332.000|20110112010334.000|TR0|SPITZER:  Sir, I guess the place we just 
20110112010334.000|20110112010336.000|TR0|have to begin is, what did you make of 
20110112010336.000|20110112010339.000|TR0|Jared Loughner in your class?  What were 
20110112010339.000|20110112010341.000|TR0|your impressions of him?
20110112010341.000|20110112010343.000|TR0|
20110112010343.000|20110112010345.000|TR0|SLINKER:  Well, he was, as so many have 
20110112010345.000|20110112010347.000|TR0|reported, an odd student but to be honest 
20110112010347.000|20110112010349.000|TR0|I thought he was my first student with 
20110112010349.000|20110112010352.000|TR0|Tourette syndrome because that's more -- 
20110112010352.000|20110112010354.000|TR0|what would happened, the outbursts and the 
20110112010354.000|20110112010356.000|TR0|odd questions and that type of behavior, 
20110112010356.000|20110112010358.000|TR0|so you just try to do your best to give 
20110112010358.000|20110112010400.000|TR0|logical concepts across to someone who may 
20110112010400.000|20110112010403.000|TR0|have difficulties in that sense.
20110112010403.000|20110112010405.000|TR0|
20110112010405.000|20110112010407.000|TR0|I certainly didn't feel any threat from 
20110112010407.000|20110112010409.000|TR0|him.  Certainly not any violence.  Other 
20110112010409.000|20110112010411.000|TR0|than that, other than finding out he was 
20110112010411.000|20110112010413.000|TR0|the shooter, which was quite shocking, I 
20110112010413.000|20110112010416.000|TR0|don't think I have any real unique 
20110112010416.000|20110112010418.000|TR0|insights to Mr. Loughner.
20110112010418.000|20110112010420.000|TR0|
20110112010420.000|20110112010422.000|TR0|PARKER:  Mister Slinker, in the picture 
20110112010422.000|20110112010424.000|TR0|that we've all seen now of Mr. Loughner 
20110112010424.000|20110112010427.000|TR0|when he was photographed for the mug shot 
20110112010427.000|20110112010429.000|TR0|shows a man with -- you know, sort of wild 
20110112010429.000|20110112010431.000|TR0|looking eyes and his head has been shaved. 
20110112010431.000|20110112010433.000|TR0| Is that the student you remember?
20110112010433.000|20110112010435.000|TR0|
20110112010435.000|20110112010438.000|TR0|SLINKER:  No, not at all.  The student I 
20110112010438.000|20110112010440.000|TR0|remember -- I know that there's a picture 
20110112010440.000|20110112010442.000|TR0|on the Internet.  He had short hair.  
20110112010442.000|20110112010444.000|TR0|Certainly not shaven.  And I recall he had 
20110112010444.000|20110112010446.000|TR0|an intense stare and yet blue eyes as I 
20110112010446.000|20110112010448.000|TR0|recall.  But he usually didn't stare at 
20110112010448.000|20110112010451.000|TR0|other people.  He would have a focused 
20110112010451.000|20110112010453.000|TR0|stare some place else in the room, and 
20110112010453.000|20110112010455.000|TR0|almost as if he was viewing another scene 
20110112010455.000|20110112010457.000|TR0|or intensely thinking about something.
20110112010457.000|20110112010459.000|TR0|
20110112010459.000|20110112010502.000|TR0|One occasion he would ask questions and as 
20110112010502.000|20110112010504.000|TR0|many have reported those questions were 
20110112010504.000|20110112010506.000|TR0|incoherent and didn't seem to have 
20110112010506.000|20110112010508.000|TR0|anything to do with the discussion at hand 
20110112010508.000|20110112010510.000|TR0|or what was being taught.
20110112010510.000|20110112010513.000|TR0|
20110112010513.000|20110112010515.000|TR0|SPITZER:  You know, your course was one 
20110112010515.000|20110112010517.000|TR0|about logic and yet everything we see and 
20110112010517.000|20110112010519.000|TR0|read and hear about Mr. Loughner is just 
20110112010519.000|20110112010521.000|TR0|the opposite.  It was almost a randomness, 
20110112010521.000|20110112010523.000|TR0|incoherence.
20110112010523.000|20110112010526.000|TR0|
20110112010526.000|20110112010528.000|TR0|Did he seem capable of grasping logical 
20110112010528.000|20110112010530.000|TR0|concepts and how ideas flowed one to the 
20110112010530.000|20110112010532.000|TR0|next?
20110112010532.000|20110112010534.000|TR0|
20110112010534.000|20110112010537.000|TR0|SLINKER:  It's difficult to say really 
20110112010537.000|20110112010539.000|TR0|what his inner thoughts were.  Obviously 
20110112010539.000|20110112010541.000|TR0|I'm not in a position legally to disclose 
20110112010541.000|20110112010543.000|TR0|any of his performance on tests or 
20110112010543.000|20110112010545.000|TR0|homework, but I did want to try to reach 
20110112010545.000|20110112010547.000|TR0|out to him, and I did try to reach out to 
20110112010547.000|20110112010550.000|TR0|him.
20110112010550.000|20110112010552.000|TR0|
20110112010552.000|20110112010554.000|TR0|I wrote notes on his homework or perhaps 
20110112010554.000|20110112010556.000|TR0|tests asking him to talk to me after class 
20110112010556.000|20110112010558.000|TR0|to express perhaps different options.
20110112010558.000|20110112010601.000|TR0|
20110112010601.000|20110112010603.000|TR0|You know in this case sometimes students 
20110112010603.000|20110112010605.000|TR0|will learn logical concepts visually.  
20110112010605.000|20110112010607.000|TR0|Sometimes certain areas of logic they will 
20110112010607.000|20110112010609.000|TR0|get and I just wanted to get my foot in 
20110112010609.000|20110112010612.000|TR0|the door even if it just meant that, OK, 
20110112010612.000|20110112010614.000|TR0|he got that part.  It would be just a 
20110112010614.000|20110112010616.000|TR0|success for him and he could feel good 
20110112010616.000|20110112010618.000|TR0|about something that he had accomplished 
20110112010618.000|20110112010620.000|TR0|in the class.
20110112010620.000|20110112010622.000|TR0|
20110112010622.000|20110112010625.000|TR0|But unfortunately he would always run out 
20110112010625.000|20110112010627.000|TR0|of the class pretty quickly with his eyes 
20110112010627.000|20110112010629.000|TR0|turned down.  I thought at one point I 
20110112010629.000|20110112010631.000|TR0|would really be able to reach out to him 
20110112010631.000|20110112010633.000|TR0|but that's a two-way street and it never 
20110112010633.000|20110112010636.000|TR0|occurred.
20110112010636.000|20110112010638.000|TR0|
20110112010638.000|20110112010640.000|TR0|PARKER:  Well, did you think about taking 
20110112010640.000|20110112010642.000|TR0|it any further and getting in touch with 
20110112010642.000|20110112010644.000|TR0|someone else outside the classroom?
20110112010644.000|20110112010647.000|TR0|
20110112010647.000|20110112010649.000|TR0|SLINKER:  Well, I did discuss it with my 
20110112010649.000|20110112010651.000|TR0|department chair who had him in a 
20110112010651.000|20110112010653.000|TR0|meditations class at the same -- at the 
20110112010653.000|20110112010655.000|TR0|same semester and pretty much Pima, it's a 
20110112010655.000|20110112010657.000|TR0|community college with limited resources 
20110112010657.000|20110112010700.000|TR0|and our concern was to try to get him 
20110112010700.000|20110112010702.000|TR0|perhaps academic help.
20110112010702.000|20110112010704.000|TR0|
20110112010704.000|20110112010706.000|TR0|If he had some type of learning 
20110112010706.000|20110112010708.000|TR0|disability, we have -- we have people who 
20110112010708.000|20110112010711.000|TR0|are experts in that area and sometimes 
20110112010711.000|20110112010713.000|TR0|special accommodations can be given such 
20110112010713.000|20110112010715.000|TR0|as extended test taking time in a testing 
20110112010715.000|20110112010717.000|TR0|center or a note taker or perhaps having a 
20110112010717.000|20110112010719.000|TR0|digital recorder in class.  And we tried 
20110112010719.000|20110112010721.000|TR0|to do that but these students have to 
20110112010721.000|20110112010724.000|TR0|self- identify.  I don't have the power to 
20110112010724.000|20110112010726.000|TR0|say you must go here and take this test.
20110112010726.000|20110112010728.000|TR0|
20110112010728.000|20110112010730.000|TR0|But I actually thought at the time I might 
20110112010730.000|20110112010732.000|TR0|be able to get him to do that, but I never 
20110112010732.000|20110112010735.000|TR0|was able to talk to him on a one-to-one 
20110112010735.000|20110112010737.000|TR0|basis. And I did worry about him a lot.  
20110112010737.000|20110112010739.000|TR0|He came to class.  He was -- he wore clean 
20110112010739.000|20110112010741.000|TR0|clothes.  He was well fed.  Clean shaven.  
20110112010741.000|20110112010743.000|TR0|And obviously I thought he had Tourette's 
20110112010743.000|20110112010746.000|TR0|so I wasn't too concerned about, you know, 
20110112010746.000|20110112010748.000|TR0|going off the deep end or anything like 
20110112010748.000|20110112010750.000|TR0|that.
20110112010750.000|20110112010752.000|TR0|
20110112010752.000|20110112010754.000|TR0|But I did -- I do recall thinking I hope 
20110112010754.000|20110112010756.000|TR0|his parents know what's going on and that 
20110112010756.000|20110112010759.000|TR0|they have a handle on things.

20110112010915.000|20110112010917.000|TR0|
20110112010917.000|20110112010920.000|TR0|Quoting here.  "This is a very difficult 
20110112010920.000|20110112010922.000|TR0|time for us.  We ask the media to respect 
20110112010922.000|20110112010924.000|TR0|our privacy.  There are no words that can 
20110112010924.000|20110112010926.000|TR0|possibly express how we feel.  We care 
20110112010926.000|20110112010928.000|TR0|very deeply about the victims and their 
20110112010928.000|20110112010930.000|TR0|families.  We are so very sorry for their 
20110112010930.000|20110112010933.000|TR0|loss."
20110112010933.000|20110112010935.000|TR0|
20110112010935.000|20110112010937.000|TR0|SPITZER:  So how did this seemingly 
20110112010937.000|20110112010939.000|TR0|typical high school kid transform into 
20110112010939.000|20110112010941.000|TR0|someone capable of such an absolutely 
20110112010941.000|20110112010944.000|TR0|horrific act?  At this point, we just 
20110112010944.000|20110112010946.000|TR0|aren't certain but from everything we've 
20110112010946.000|20110112010948.000|TR0|learned Jared Loughner was sending some 
20110112010948.000|20110112010950.000|TR0|pretty clear signals that he was deeply 
20110112010950.000|20110112010952.000|TR0|disturbed.
20110112010952.000|20110112010954.000|TR0|
20110112010954.000|20110112010957.000|TR0|PARKER:  Here to interpret those signs is

20110112011507.000|20110112011509.000|TR0|
20110112011509.000|20110112011511.000|TR0|SALTZ:  You know, here's the thing.  
20110112011511.000|20110112011514.000|TR0|Believe it or not actually because people 
20110112011514.000|20110112011516.000|TR0|I think often think people who are really 
20110112011516.000|20110112011518.000|TR0|ill are often violent, that is not the 
20110112011518.000|20110112011520.000|TR0|case.  In fact, it's unusual for someone 
20110112011520.000|20110112011522.000|TR0|even with a severe psychotic illness to 
20110112011522.000|20110112011525.000|TR0|actually do something horribly violent.
20110112011525.000|20110112011527.000|TR0|
20110112011527.000|20110112011529.000|TR0|That being said, this person apparently 
20110112011529.000|20110112011531.000|TR0|was involved with drugs. Now that combined 
20110112011531.000|20110112011533.000|TR0|with mental illness greatly increases the 
20110112011533.000|20110112011535.000|TR0|chance of violence.  In fact drugs by 
20110112011535.000|20110112011538.000|TR0|themselves increase the chance of 
20110112011538.000|20110112011540.000|TR0|violence.  But when you have mental 
20110112011540.000|20110112011542.000|TR0|illness it progresses.
20110112011542.000|20110112011544.000|TR0|
20110112011544.000|20110112011546.000|TR0|And so somebody may not appear to be 
20110112011546.000|20110112011549.000|TR0|violent but having quiet violent thoughts 
20110112011549.000|20110112011551.000|TR0|that are hallucinations, in fact, often 
20110112011551.000|20110112011553.000|TR0|and then at some point it builds and 
20110112011553.000|20110112011555.000|TR0|builds.  And the illness gets worse if 
20110112011555.000|20110112011557.000|TR0|it's untreated and ultimately something 
20110112011557.000|20110112011600.000|TR0|violent can happen.

20110112011835.000|20110112011837.000|TR0|SPITZER:  If I have just one question on

20110112011843.000|20110112011846.000|TR0|
20110112011846.000|20110112011848.000|TR0|PARKER:  Here to help us understand what's 
20110112011848.000|20110112011850.000|TR0|involved in buying and owning firearms in 
20110112011850.000|20110112011852.000|TR0|Arizona is Alan Korwin, a journalist and 
20110112011852.000|20110112011854.000|TR0|author of several books including "The 
20110112011854.000|20110112011857.000|TR0|Arizona Gun Owner's Guide."
20110112011857.000|20110112011859.000|TR0|
20110112011859.000|20110112011901.000|TR0|Welcome, Alan.
20110112011901.000|20110112011903.000|TR0|
20110112011903.000|20110112011905.000|TR0|ALAN KORWIN, AUTHOR, THE ARIZONA GUN 
20110112011905.000|20110112011907.000|TR0|OWNER'S GUIDE:  Nice to be here.
20110112011907.000|20110112011910.000|TR0|
20110112011910.000|20110112011912.000|TR0|PARKER:  So, Alan, walk us through this 
20110112011912.000|20110112011914.000|TR0|step by step.  How do you buy a gun in 
20110112011914.000|20110112011916.000|TR0|Arizona?  I walk in a store, what happens?
20110112011916.000|20110112011918.000|TR0|
20110112011918.000|20110112011921.000|TR0|KORWIN:  Well, any law abiding adult in 
20110112011921.000|20110112011923.000|TR0|America actually can buy a firearm.  It's 
20110112011923.000|20110112011925.000|TR0|legal property.  And they go through a 
20110112011925.000|20110112011927.000|TR0|pretty standard process.  You fill out a 
20110112011927.000|20110112011929.000|TR0|4473 form.  It takes your name and address 
20110112011929.000|20110112011932.000|TR0|and other identifying information that 
20110112011932.000|20110112011934.000|TR0|identifies the firearm. And it identifies 
20110112011934.000|20110112011936.000|TR0|the dealer.
20110112011936.000|20110112011938.000|TR0|
20110112011938.000|20110112011940.000|TR0|And you list -- you fill out an entire 
20110112011940.000|20110112011942.000|TR0|list of questions on disqualifying factors 
20110112011942.000|20110112011945.000|TR0|and then the dealer performs a NICS 
20110112011945.000|20110112011947.000|TR0|background check through the FBI.  The FBI 
20110112011947.000|20110112011949.000|TR0|has a list in theory of everybody who 
20110112011949.000|20110112011951.000|TR0|can't own a firearm for felony conviction,

20110112013155.000|20110112013157.000|TR0|into the system, to put in every time

20110112013432.000|20110112013434.000|TR0|keep and bear arms.   But there's also the

20110112013436.000|20110112013439.000|TR0|Congress can regulate interstate commerce 
20110112013439.000|20110112013441.000|TR0|and guns even if they are only made in 
20110112013441.000|20110112013443.000|TR0|state affect interstate commerce.  They 
20110112013443.000|20110112013445.000|TR0|shoot people.  They create law enforcement
